PARAGRAPH.STRING: (German IPA: [IPA: /ˈtsyːʁɪç/], in Zürich German Züri [IPA: [ˈtsyri]]; in English often Zurich) is the largest city in Switzerland (population: 366,145 in 2004; population of urban area: 1,091,732) and capital of the canton of Zürich. The metropolitan population is around 1.3 million.
is Switzerland's main commercial and cultural centre (the political capital of Switzerland being Bern), and
is widely considered to be one of the world's global cities. According to a survey in 2006,
is the city with the best quality of life in the world.
The origin of the name is probably the Celtic word Turus, a corroborating reference to which was found on a tomb inscription dating from the Roman occupation in the 2nd century; the antique name of
in its romanized form was Turicum.
